text: this is the scene at Hong Kong
International Airport both levels are
completely full black-clad pro-democracy
demonstrators have occupied every inch
of this terminal and if we come over
here you can even see down the bottom
how many thousands of chanting
protesters there are they're calling for
an inquiry into the police following
their clashes over the weekend people
will have seen that footage of riot
police charging into an underground
train station hitting protesters and
firing at point-blank range with some
sort of non-lethal rounds is really
enraged people and they've come to the
airport to join the protest that was
already here but this Airport is now
effectively shuts down if you haven't
checked in we have people still coming
in with their bags what they're going to
find though is they can't check in
because all the checking counters have
been closed any flights from now on but
don't have passengers already cleared
security have been cancelled for the
rest of the day police have arrived with
tear gas warning signs airport officials
are warning people not to come to the
airport and it looks like there will be
a major showdown between these thousands
of protesters and riot police sometime
today as the authorities try and clear
the pro-democracy movement out of the
airport
